title: AC trouble: Air India Tokyo-Delhi flight safely diverts to Kolkata
content: On June 29, 2025, Air India flight AI357, en route from Tokyo Haneda to Delhi, made a precautionary diversion to Kolkata due to persistent air-conditioning issues causing uncomfortably warm cabin temperatures. The Boeing 787 landed safely in Kolkata, where passengers are receiving support and alternative arrangements are being made to fly them to Delhi. The aircraft is currently undergoing checks.

title: Viral video: 'I stay serious so that others can ...' - Gambhir on The Kapil Sharma Show
content: Gautam Gambhir, India's head coach, has finally revealed the reason behind his serious demeanour. On The Kapil Sharma Show, Gambhir explained that he remains serious so others can smile, emphasising his focus and commitment to results. He also addressed his on-field confrontations, stating they are always for the country, not himself.

title: Bihar voter list row: Why EC’s special revision is facing political heat - explained
content: The Election Commission's announcement of a special intensive revision of electoral rolls in Bihar has ignited political controversy ahead of the upcoming assembly elections. The EC aims to remove illegal immigrants from voter lists, sparking opposition concerns about the timing and potential disenfranchisement of marginalized communities.

title: OpenAI CEO takes one of the biggest AI U-Turn; says: Current computers are …
content: Sam Altman has shifted his stance on AI hardware, now believing new devices are essential as AI evolves, contrasting his previous view. He envisions AI systems deeply integrated into users' lives, moving beyond traditional interfaces. This change aligns with Jony Ive's arrival at OpenAI, sparking speculation about a groundbreaking AI device slated for release in late 2026.

title: 'GF hogi, wife hogi': Sanjana recalls first meeting; Bumrah reacts, 'What logic is that?'
content: Jasprit Bumrah and Sanjana Ganesan humorously recounted their initial encounter during the 2019 World Cup, where Sanjana mistakenly believed Bumrah was avoiding her due to a presumed girlfriend or wife. Bumrah clarified that his shy nature led to the initial awkwardness. Eventually, they connected, married in 2021, and welcomed their son in 2023.

title: Rift in TMC: Kalyan Banerjee drags Moitra's personal life; takes 'honeymoon' jibe
content: Trinamool Congress MPs Kalyan Banerjee and Mahua Moitra are embroiled in another public dispute, this time over Banerjee's controversial remarks regarding the South Calcutta Law College rape case. Banerjee responded to Moitra's criticism by attacking her personal life, referencing her marriage and questioning her ethics.

title: Did Altman lie? Ex-OpenAI engineer joining Meta on $100M signing bonus
content: Lucas Beyer, a recent Meta hire from OpenAI, refuted claims of a $100 million signing bonus, dismissing them as "fake news." This follows Sam Altman's suggestion of Meta's extravagant offers to lure talent. Meta's CTO criticized Altman's tactics as dishonest, highlighting the ongoing talent war and Meta's significant AI investments.

title: MLC: Unmukt Chand is LAKR's lone bright spot, but will USA Cricket notice?
content: After struggling in the first two Major League Cricket (MLC) seasons, Unmukt Chand has finally found his feet in the US, where he moved to live his ultimate dream: “to play for the US national team.” The right-handed batter has scored 243 runs in seven innings and is sixth on the list of top run-getters in the ongoing MLC 2025.

title: Puri stampede: Two senior cops suspended, top officials transferred
content: A deadly stampede near the Gundicha Temple in Puri during the Rath Yatra festival resulted in three fatalities and over 50 injuries. The chaos, attributed to poor crowd management and unauthorized vehicles, drew sharp criticism and prompted a government investigation. Eyewitnesses reported confusion and inadequate response, while former CM Patnaik slammed the administration's incompetence following the tragedy.

title: US govt message to Visa applicants: From July 1, immigration agency to no longer send...
content: USCIS is changing its text message number to 872466 (USAIMM) from July 1, 2025, to help users easily identify official communications. Applicants should save the new number to avoid confusion.

title: 'It's up to them': Owaisi keen on joining Mahagathbandhan in Bihar; says NDA must go
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has expressed his eagerness to join the Mahagathbandhan alliance for the upcoming Bihar assembly elections, aiming to prevent the BJP-led NDA from retaining power. Despite past unsuccessful attempts, AIMIM is ready to contest in Seemanchal and other regions, urging the opposition to unite against the NDA.

title: Drama! FIDE slams Kramnik's defamation lawsuit: 'Brings a lot of harm to chess'
content: The International Chess Federation (FIDE) has intervened in the dispute between Vladimir Kramnik and David Navara. FIDE expresses concern over the impact of Kramnik's accusations. It supports Navara and asks Kramnik to withdraw his defamation lawsuit. Levon Aronian has also appealed to Kramnik for reconciliation. FIDE emphasizes fairness and unity within the chess community.

title: Railways' 3 big ticketing changes: Charting, Tatkal, reservations explained
content: Indian Railways is set to introduce significant changes to its passenger reservation system, aiming to enhance passenger comfort. Key improvements include preparing reservation charts eight hours in advance, implementing verified user-only Tatkal ticket bookings with OTP authentication by July 2025, and launching a new passenger reservation system by December 2025.

title: Blake Lively stops Swift from cutting her off as Kelce backs Taylor quietly
content: Blake Lively is reportedly struggling to salvage her friendship with Taylor Swift amidst the fallout from her legal issues with Justin Baldoni. As Travis Kelce distances himself from Ryan Reynolds, Lively is allegedly making desperate attempts to reconcile with Swift, even enlisting mutual friends for assistance. However, Swift's inner circle seems to be siding with her, leaving Lively's efforts uncertain.

title: 'Found friends on foreign soil': Nostalgic reunion lights up Team India nets - Watch
content: During preparations for the second Test against England, the Indian cricket team enjoyed a heartwarming reunion at Edgbaston as familiar faces from home joined their net practice. Current and former teammates reminisced about their shared journey, strengthening bonds. Jasprit Bumrah's return to the nets raised hopes, while the team focused on improving lower-order batting.

title: PM Modi plays audio of Vajpayee, Desai to sharpen attack over Emergency
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in his Mann ki Baat address, recalled the Emergency imposed 50 years ago, terming it a dark chapter for Indian democracy. He stated that those who imposed it suppressed the judiciary and murdered the Constitution's spirit. Modi emphasized remembering those who fought against the Emergency to safeguard the Constitution.

title: IND v ENG: 'Bowling has to be ...' - Azhar urges India to reduce Bumrah dependency
content: Mohammad Azharuddin has cautioned India against over-relying on Jasprit Bumrah and suggested including Kuldeep Yadav for the second Test against England. He emphasised the need for a more varied bowling attack to support Bumrah. Azharuddin defended Shubman Gill's captaincy, urging patience and support for the new captain despite the team's batting collapse and defeat in the first Test.

title: Starlink launch: Spacex launches 27 satellites after storm delays
content: Despite severe weather warnings, SpaceX successfully launched a Falcon 9 rocket carrying 27 Starlink satellites from Cape Canaveral. The launch coincided with the 10th anniversary of a Falcon 9 explosion, highlighting SpaceX's progress. The mission featured a reusable booster flying its fifth mission, landing successfully on the drone ship, demonstrating SpaceX's commitment to sustainable space travel.

title: Solo Sikoa opens up: Jacob Fatu 'didn’t wanna come back'; after US title win
content: At Night of Champions 2025, Solo Sikoa defeated Jacob Fatu for the United States Championship, marking a significant shift in the Bloodline's power dynamics. Sikoa, now leading a revamped Bloodline with Tonga Loa and Tala Tonga, declared he cut ties with Fatu and Jimmy Uso for their disobedience.

title: IND vs ENG: Fined! England slapped with heavy penalty after 1st T20I defeat to India Women
content: England's women's cricket team has been fined a percentage of their match fee due to a slow over-rate during their first T20 International against India, where they suffered a significant 97-run defeat. The penalty issued by the ICC after the hosts were found to be two overs short of the required number.

title: Dwyane Wade, Union admit: 'We didn’t do it right' on child born during split
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union, both previously married, have built a strong and enduring marriage. They attribute their success to learning from past mistakes, prioritizing open communication, and supporting each other's careers. Despite challenges, including a brief separation and Wade fathering a child with another woman, they've created a blended family and continue to thrive.

title: 'The King': Parag hails Kohli as his inspiration; all-rounder reveals why
content: Riyan Parag, the emerging Indian all-rounder, considers Virat Kohli his cricketing inspiration, fondly calling him "The king who gave me my India cap." Kohli presented Parag with his ODI cap in August 2024, acknowledging his potential as a match-winner. Despite a modest debut, Parag's IPL performances and Kohli's encouragement have fueled his international aspirations.

title: Rohit on Pant's 'fake injury' during T20 WC final: 'Genuinely thought ...'
content: India's T20 World Cup victory over South Africa in Barbados, a moment etched in history, saw Rohit Sharma's team end a 11-year ICC title drought. Sharma recently revealed Rishabh Pant's clever tactic during South Africa's chase. Pant's strategic pause, feigning a knee issue, disrupted South Africa's momentum, leading to a crucial wicket.

title: Watch: 'Who broke my bat?' - Siraj fumes during practice before IND vs ENG 2nd Test
content: Ahead of the second Test against England, Mohammed Siraj practiced batting. Siraj found his bat broken. This caused a moment of surprise. The incident occurred during practice at Edgbaston. India aims to level the series after a defeat. Lower-order batting is a key concern for the team. Siraj's reaction to the broken bat showed his positive attitude.

title: IND v ENG: 'Far too defensive' - Ex-India cricketer urges captain Gill to be aggressive
content: Following India's defeat to England, Sanjay Manjrekar critiqued Shubman Gill's captaincy, suggesting he was overly defensive despite favourable conditions. Manjrekar contrasted Gill's approach with Virat Kohli's aggressive style. He lauded Rishabh Pant's form but cautioned KL Rahul against inconsistency. India, trailing 0-1, faces England in the second Test at Edgbaston.

title: Iran warns Israel may break ceasefire, says ‘prepared to give strong response’
content: Iran's top military commander has voiced strong skepticism regarding Israel's adherence to the ceasefire agreement. He conveyed to Saudi Arabia's defense minister Tehran's readiness to retaliate forcefully should Israel resume hostilities. Despite not initiating the conflict, Iran asserts it responded with full force and remains prepared to do so again if necessary.

title: 24-year-old Indian woman goes missing in US; had gone for arranged marriage
content: Simran Simran, a 24-year-old woman from India, has been reported missing in New Jersey just days after arriving in the US for an arranged marriage. Surveillance footage shows her alone and seemingly waiting, but not distressed.

title: Shivakumar to be Karnataka CM? Congress MLA's big 2-3 months claim
content: Congress MLA H A Iqbal Hussain has ignited speculation about a potential leadership change in Karnataka, suggesting D K Shivakumar could become chief minister within months. Hussain emphasised Shivakumar's significant role in the party's victory and expressed confidence in the high command's decision-making. While dismissing claims of a revolution, he acknowledged the expectation for change.

title: 'I did marry a farmer': Hailee Steinfeld wants to trade glam for a garden
content: Following their recent wedding and honeymoon, Hailee Steinfeld is expressing a desire for a simpler life. She dreams of living on a farm, growing vegetables, and raising chickens. This vision aligns with Josh Allen's upbringing on a 2,000-acre farm in California, potentially making their shared dream a reality despite their high-profile careers.

title: Vinay Sapru recalls discovering Shefali Jariwala with Radhika Rao; Exclusive
content: Filmmaker Vinay Sapru, who along with Radhika Rao directed the iconic Kaanta Laga music video that turned Shefali Jariwala into an overnight sensation, has spoken exclusively to ETimes about the late star’s sudden passing and the unforgettable journey they shared.

title: 'Will I play again?': Rishabh Pant's painful question
content: Indian cricketer Rishabh Pant's remarkable recovery from a life-threatening car accident in December 2022 is truly inspiring. Orthopedic surgeon Dr. Dinshaw Pardiwala, who led Pant's treatment, revealed the extent of his injuries and the initial concerns about his ability to walk, let alone play cricket again.

title: ‘We’re sorry’: Newborn left outside orphanage with handwritten note
content: In Panvel, a newborn girl was discovered abandoned outside an orphanage on Saturday morning. The infant was found with a feeding bottle, food, clothes, and a note from the parents expressing regret and citing financial and mental inability to care for her. The parents indicated a potential future return.

title: Wait ends: Monsoon reaches Delhi, envelops India 9 days early
content: The monsoon arrived in Delhi on June 29, 2025, a day earlier than expected, and covered the entire country nine days ahead of schedule. This is the fastest monsoon coverage since 2020. An orange alert has been issued for several districts in Himachal Pradesh due to heavy rainfall, with warnings of potential flash floods and landslides.

title: 'Shut down NTA': CUET UG 2025 result delay sparks nationwide outrage
content: The delay in CUET UG 2025 results has sparked national outrage, with students and educators criticizing the NTA's lack of communication and alleged mismanagement. Concerns about exam integrity and systemic failures, including unresponsive helplines, are intensifying calls for reform. Universities are facing disrupted academic calendars as they await the results to begin admissions.

title: Made videos, body-shamed girls: How 'Mango's' campus abuse was ignored for yrs
content: Manojit Mishra, accused of gang-rape, was known at his Kolkata law college for alleged abuse of power and instilling fear, particularly among women. He reportedly recorded private moments, morphed pictures, and shared them in WhatsApp groups for ridicule.

title: 'Even Virat Kohli was thinking ... ': Rohit Sharma on Kohli’s mental strength
content: Reflecting on India's T20 World Cup victory, Rohit Sharma highlighted Virat Kohli's pivotal 76-run innings and his crucial partnership with Axar Patel against South Africa. Sharma emphasized Kohli's experience and composure under pressure, which anchored the innings after early wickets fell.

title: Kolkata horror: 7-hr CCTV footage under lens; 90-second assault clip found
content: Kolkata Police have formed a Special Investigation Team to investigate the gang rape of a law student on her college campus. The team is analyzing CCTV footage and technical evidence, while the survivor's medical report confirms the assault. Three suspects, including an alumnus, have been arrested, and video clippings of the crime were retrieved from their phones.

title: CSK star batter creates history, smashes world record on Test debut
content: In a historic Test match against Zimbabwe, South Africa witnessed remarkable debuts. Dewald Brevis smashed the fastest fifty in a debut Test innings, while Lhuan-dre Pretorius became South Africa's youngest Test centurion, surpassing a 61-year-old record. Their performances highlighted the depth of young talent and validated South Africa's strategy of nurturing emerging cricketers.

title: Telangana horror: Man sets mother on fire over financial dispute
content: In a horrifying incident in Warangal, Muttineni Satish, an alcoholic, set his mother, Muttineni Vinoda, on fire after she refused to give him more money. Vinoda sustained 80% burns and is in critical condition. Satish had been harassing his parents for money after they received compensation for their land, leading to this brutal act.

title: Iran confirms 71 killed in Israeli strike on Evin prison; top prosecutor among the dead
content: An Israeli airstrike on Tehran's Evin prison, a facility notorious for holding political prisoners, resulted in at least 71 deaths, according to Iran's judiciary. The June 23 attack, part of a broader Israeli campaign against Iranian military infrastructure, killed inmates, guards, and civilians. Among the detainees are French citizens held on espionage charges.

title: Jake Paul dominates early rounds to beat Julio Cesar Chavez Jr in Anaheim
content: Jake Paul showcased a disciplined performance, securing a unanimous decision victory over Julio Cesar Chavez Jr. in their California bout. Paul's aggressive jabs and body punches established his dominance early, overcoming Chavez Jr.'s experience. Despite late fatigue, Paul absorbed counters and eyes future fights against cruiserweight titleholders Gilberto Ramirez and Badou Jack, signaling his serious ambitions in boxing.

title: CHOs continue to wait for government response on resolution of demands
content: Stopping work, the CHOs had launched a Statewide protest on April 24 that continued for around 40 days

title: Kerala govt. firm on Zumba in schools, seeks an end to controversy
content: Several Muslim organisations seek to moderate the controversy in larger civic interest. SNDP Yogam backs government, BJP questions the wisdom of introducing the dance form in schools. Sivankutty says students are free to choose not to attend Zumba classes.  Youth Congress, SFI, and DYFI denounce move to impose religious considerations on sports and art forms

title: Speculation on leadership change in Karnataka surfaces again
content: While Ramanagara MLA predicts DKS may become CM in next two to three months, Minister H.C. Mahadevappa says Siddaramaiah will complete full term

title: Farmers in Kandukur intensify protest against Andhra Pradesh government’s plan to acquire 8,300 acres for solar project
content: Kandukur Sub-Collector visits the spot and promises to submit a report to the government on the ground situation

title: RLD pushes for Brahmin welfare board in Uttar Pradesh
content: “There is a pressing need for targeted support to economically weaker sections within the Brahmin community”, told RLD National Secretary Anupam Mishra, to The Hindu.

title: 50 stray dogs under observation for rabies at ABC centre
content: They are suspected to have been bitten by another stray dog that died recently and was later found to have had rabies

title: Authorities work to contain jaundice outbreak at a locality in Agartala
content: 52 persons in the Master Para locality of Agartala have been diagnosed as having jaundice; the Chief Medical Officer has directed govt. departments to contain the outbreak

title: KSRTC electric buses proposed inside Puthur Zoological Park
content: Feasibility study conducted for KSRTC electric buses at Puthur Zoological Park to enhance visitor transport convenience.

title: Former YSRCP MLA forced to leave Tadipatri as clashes erupt
content: Anarchy is prevailing in Tadipatri, alleges Pedda Reddy adding that he will move the High Court again on the issue

title: Residents of Holiday Village Road pray for divine intervention to fix deteriorated road
content: Frustrated by crumbling infrastructure and repeated inaction by authorities, residents performed a  pooja as a mark of their protest

title: Prepare for 2029 poll win, forestall YSRCP ‘misinformation campaign’, Naidu tells TDP leaders
content: Each one of us should reach out to every household and explain what the NDA government did in the last one year in order to win their confidence, says TDP chief, while cautioning the leaders that their performance is being closely monitored

title: Old warrants, new arrests
content: More than a decade after tribal communities in Odisha’s Narayanpatna block launched a movement against liquor vendors from outside their community which led to a struggle to reclaim their lost land, arrest warrants are now being effected against them. Prompted by a court order and executed by the police, people say they are being ‘punished’ for a mass uprising while the police claim people have Naxal links under the Chasi Mulia Adivasi Sangha, reports Satyasundar Barik

title: 162 students trapped in inundated residential school in Jharkhand after heavy rain rescued
content: As the single-storey school building was submerged, teachers shifted the students to the rooftop, where they spent the night. On information, the police rescued them on the morning of June 29, 2025. An orange alert has been issued for multiple regions for June 30 and July 1

title: Eshwarappa says talks ongoing within BJP on bringing him back to the party fold
content: I stand for Hindutva. I will remain committed to it. I will never leave the BJP, asserts the former Deputy Chief Minister

title: Where myth and nature come alive on canvas
content: Known for his delicate lines and stylised figures, Karunakaran’s work stands out for its distinctive portrayal of the female form

title: Will reach out to Centre seeking protection of Kakinada wetlands: BJP leader
content: Public representatives are being consulted for the protection of the wetlands; For Kakinada Smart City, Chollangi wetland is what wetlands in Navi Mumbai are for Mumbai city for coastal security, says BJP Former Kakinada District President Ch. Ram Kumar.

title: Maharashtra scraps resolution to make Hindi as third language
content: Maharashtra govt cancels GRs on three-language policy; CM Fadnavis announces panel on language formula implementation

title: Belagavi Mayor, city corporation member disqualified; BJP calls it politically motivated
content: Urban Development Secretary upholds the Regional Commissioner’s earlier orders disqualifying the two

title: Kerala HC upholds single judge’s directive for re-look at age limits under ART Act
content: Upper age limit for men is 55 and 50 for women under Section 21(g) of the Assisted Reproductive Technology (Regulation) Act

title: Hyderabad committee offers ‘Bangaru Bonam’ to Goddess Kanaka Druga
content: Minister of Endowments Anam Ramnarayana Reddy and Sri Durga Malleswara Swamyvarla Devastanam Executive Officer V.K. Seena Naik and others welcomed the committee members atop Indrakeeladri

title: Bihar education system is ruined, the worst in the country under JD(U)-BJP government: Digvijay Singh
content: The Congress leader criticises poor condition of schools and high dropout rates and alleges that ₹60,954 crore allocated in budget is lost to corruption. He claims 1.13 crore youth are deprived of higher education and says the government is in cahoots with the paper mafia, referring to exam paper leaks

title: INDIA bloc may knock door of judiciary against Special Intensive Revision drive: Digvijaya Singh
content: Digvijaya Singh criticises the NDA government for disenfranchising voters in Bihar through the Special Intensive Revision drive before assembly polls

title: Deve Gowda urges people to join hands in the fight to get State’s share of Krishna water
content: He was addressing a gathering after inaugurating ‘Janarondige Janata Dal’ and receiving facilitation in Deodurg of Raichur district

title: ‘Bharat Mata’ row: Kerala University Vice-Chancellor rejects Registrar’s explanation of attempt to cancel event
content: Registrar said he attempted to cancel the booking of the hall since the organisers of the event, which marked the anniversary of Emergency, had breached the terms of the contract by displaying religious symbols

title: Valparai Assembly seat declared vacant, bypoll unlikely
content: This is the fifth time a seat in the 16th Tamil Nadu Legislative Assembly, elected in May 2021, has fallen vacant

title: Bengaluru’s Pink Line metro stretch moves a step forward as third rail testing begins on elevated section
content: This marks the beginning of a series of mandatory trials ahead of the corridor’s eventual commissioning

title: Chittoor police to conduct Slow Motorcycle Riding competition next month
content: Aim of the event is to promote public awareness on traffic regulations and discipline among motorists; All skilled riders possessing valid driving licenses can participate in the competition to be held next month

title: Kerala ex-cop’s 2,025-km pedal push against drug abuse
content: With an aim to take the fight against drug abuse straight to the streets, schools and hearts of the youth, Shahjahan launched a 2,025-km solo ride across all 14 districts of Kerala.

title: AI-powered cameras to be installed on Karnataka highways to curb accidents and violations
content: The ₹70-crore project will be implemented in three phases and is aimed at enhancing road safety using cutting-edge technology

title: Mid-term elections likely in Karnataka before Dasara, says BJP leader Sriramulu
content: Congress government is corrupt and bankrupt, and will surely fall amid confusion over transfer of power, he says

title: Watch: Shashi Tharoor and his differences with Congress Party | Talking Politics
content: In this episode of Talking Politics, we will discuss Congress MP Shashi Tharoor and his differences with the party and Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge over his remarks about PM Modi

title: Mahagathbandhan will throw Waqf Act into dustbin after forming government in Bihar: Tejashwi
content: Young leader addresses ‘Save Waqf, Save Constitution’ rally, opposing NDA government’s Waqf Act, emphasising democracy and pluralism

title: Kerala Congress (M) to submit 16-point plan for Meenachil to CM
content: Plan calls for interventions ranging from the restoration of streams and wetlands to structural and regulatory reforms

title: Bangalore University implements geotagged photos of examiners in practical exams to ensure transparency, accountability
content: Each semester, at least nine practical exams must be conducted per college, across 128 affiliated colleges, serving approximately 15,500 BCA students. The new software can help eliminate manual intervention, while improving efficiency and integrity, say officials.

title: Nearly half of central funds for border bunkers in J&K lie unused, reveals RTI
content: While 7,298 bunkers were sanctioned for the population along the LoC in the twin districts of Poonch and Rajouri, 7,162 underground bunkers got approved for villages along the IB in Jammu, Kathua and Samba districts.

title: Tejashwi ducks as drone crashes into podium at Patna rally
content: Former deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav narrowly avoids drone crash during rally in Patna; police investigating incident

title: Kolkata gang rape: Trinamool Congress issues show cause notice to MLA Madan Mitra for ‘insensitive comments’
content: “Your (Mitra) uncalled for and insensitive comments on June 28 has affected our party’s image,” the party said in the show cause notice

title: Amit Shah asks Maoists to drop guns and join mainstream as naxals would be eliminated by March 2026
content: Union Home Minister said those who want to surrender can surrender and join the mainstream like thousands of militants did in the North East to join the political mainstream

title: ‘Red alert’ for downpour in Himachal; Shimla-Kalka rail line shut after overnight rains
content: Of the 12 districts, a red alert for downpour has been issued for 10 district -- Bilapsur, Hamirpur, Kangra, Mandi, Shimla, Solan, Sirmaur, Una, Kullu and Chamba -- for June 29.

title: Alleged custodial death in Sivaganga: Edappadi Palaniswami demands judicial probe, compensation
content: The former Chief Minister condemned M.K. Stalin for his alleged inability to administer the police force.

title: Shivakumar may get CM post in 2-3 months, claims Karnataka MLA
content: These remarks from a legislator considered close to Mr. Shivakumar come amid renewed speculation about a leadership change in Karnataka later this year

title: EC to soon upload 2003 Bihar voters list on website; 4.96 crore electors need not give documents
content: Special intensive revision of Bihar voters’ list requires 4.96 crore voters from 2003 to attach relevant portion of electoral roll

title: Migrant labourer dies as land caves in at construction site in Kozhikode
content: Two other labourers who sustained grave injuries in the incident were admitted to Kozhikode Medical College Hospital

title: Simultaneous cordon and search operations held across Nandyal district in A.P.
content: The District Superintendent of Police said residences of history sheeters were searched thoroughly and the fingerprints of suspicious persons were checked with the mobile system check device

title: Opposition in Maharashtra boycotts high tea event on eve of Monsoon Session; calls Maharashtra Govt dishonest
content: Leader of Opposition in the Legislative Council Ambadas Danve of the Shiv Sena (UBT) said the boycott is a mark of protest against a “dishonest Government”

title: First phase of the Census with Houselisting operations to begin from April 1, 2026
content: In a letter to Chief Secretaries of States and Union Territories, Census Commissioner and Registrar General of India Mrityunjay Kumar Narayan said the Houselisting Operations and Housing Census shall begin on April 1, 2026.

title: After 18-year battle with genetic heart disease, 41-year-old Bengaluru resident gets transplant
content: A marketing manager by profession, Mohammed Rafi — who hails from Kerala — was diagnosed with Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy (HCM) at the age of 23.

title: Academy Awards 2025 committee: Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan congratulates Kamal Haasan on his selection as member
content: Kamal Haasan’s exceptional command over every aspect of filmmaking as a writer, singer, director, producer, and actor is truly inspiring. He is a true master of the craft, says Pawan Kalyan

title: LeBron opts in for $52.6M, watching L.A. moves
content: LeBron James is exercising his $52.6 million player option for the 2025-26 season, Klutch Sports CEO Rich Paul told ESPN. James intends to closely monitor the Lakers' moves and whether the team is positioning itself to field a title-contending roster.

title: Topuria KO's Oliveira cold, now 2-division champ
content: Ilia Topuria needed just one round to finish Charles Oliveira, knocking him out cold to capture the vacant lightweight title in the UFC 317 main event.

title: Paul easily tops Chavez, calls for 'tougher fighters'
content: Jake Paul's unlikely rise through the boxing ranks continued with a unanimous decision win over former WBC middleweight champion Julio Cesar Chavez Jr., saying afterward that he wants "to be a world champion."

title: Parker, 2-time WS champ, 7-time All-Star, dies
content: Dave Parker, a two-time World Series champion and seven-time MLB All-Star, has died at the age of 74.

title: Sources: Thunder to extend big man Williams
content: Thunder center/forward Jaylin Williams is signing a three-year, $24 million contract extension with the franchise, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Norris holds off Piastri for win; Verstappen DNF
content: Lando Norris claimed a crucial victory at the Austrian Grand Prix after overcoming teammate and title rival Oscar Piastri in a thrilling on-track duel.

title: Swiatek again slams 'intense' tennis calendar
content: Iga Swiatek criticized the relentless tennis calendar ahead of Wimbledon, saying players should not be forced to compete in more than 20 tournaments a year to maintain their rankings.

title: 'A joke': Chelsea coach slams CWC weather delays
content: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca questioned the choice of the U.S. as host of the Club World Cup and branded the two-hour weather delay in his team's win over Benfica as "a joke."

title: Is Jake Paul ready for a world title fight? Who is his best option?
content: Following his victory over Julio Cesar Chavez Jr., Jake Paul called out the cruiserweight champs. But can he get them in the ring?

title: UFC 317 takeaways: New challengers welcome!
content: Ilia Topuria at lightweight and Joshua Van at men's flyweight offer excitement at the top of their divisions.

title: Breaking down the best and worst of the NBA draft
content: Who was the steal of the draft? Which teams made risky moves? Our experts share their postdraft superlatives.

title: Detroit vs. Everybody: Are the Tigers the team to beat in MLB?
content: Detroit was the first team to win 50 games -- but do our experts actually pick the Tigers to win it all at the halfway mark?

title: Elliott uses last lap to post 'unbelievable' win
content: Home-state favorite Chase Elliott passed Brad Keselowski on the final lap and won the the crash-filled NASCAR Cup Series at Atlanta for his 20th career victory, saying afterward that "this is something I'll remember the rest of my life."

title: Paige Bueckers meets 'favorite player' Kyrie Irving after historic performance
content: The Dallas Wings star called the moment surreal as she posed with Kyrie Irving and signed a jersey for him.

title: Best power half-seasons ever: Where Cal Raleigh and Aaron Judge rank -- and whether they can keep it up
content: Two AL hitters are crushing long balls at a historic rate. Before their 81st games, we compare their first-half performances to the best ever -- and whether they can keep it going.

title: Power Rankings: A new No. 1 and a top-5 debut
content: The Mets falling as their slump continues and the Astros notching their highest ranking of the season.

title: Early 2026 NBA mock draft: Meet the four contenders for the No. 1 pick
content: There's considerable excitement around next year's draft class thanks to four players vying for the top spot.

title: Wetzel: Please don't expand NCAA basketball tournaments
content: The NCAA will risk an iconic slice of Americana if it expands the NCAA men's and women's tournaments again.

title: 'It's better if Messi plays angry': Can revenge fuel Inter Miami to shock win vs. PSG?
content: Inter Miami defied expectations by reaching the round of 16 at the Club World Cup. Now comes the really hard part: a date with the European champions ... and Messi's former club.

title: Luis Enrique: PSG can't relax vs. best ever Messi
content: Paris Saint-Germain manager Luis Enrique warned his players against ignoring the offensive threats of Lionel Messi and Inter Miami in Sunday's Club World Cup match.

title: Mexico into Gold Cup semis as Mora makes history
content: Alexis Vega scored the crucial opening goal early in the second half to help Mexico to a 2-0 win over Saudi Arabia in the Gold Cup quarterfinals.

title: Klopp: Expanded Club World Cup the worst idea
content: Former Liverpool manager Jürgen Klopp has criticised the introduction of the expanded Club World Cup format, calling it the worst idea ever implemented in football.

title: Poch hails 'great' Navas ahead of Gold Cup reunion
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino hailed Costa Rica goalkeeper Keylor Navas as "one of the best in the world" ahead of Sunday's Gold Cup quarterfinal.

title: Sources: Chelsea agree to sign Gittens; 7-yr deal
content: Chelsea have agreed a deal worth up to €65 million ($76.1m) to sign Jamie Gittens from Borussia Dortmund, sources have told ESPN.

title: Ronaldo: Saudi league already top 5 in the world
content: Cristiano Ronaldo preferred to take a rest rather than play in the revamped Club World Cup, he said on Saturday after renewing his contract with Al Nassr.

title: Schmelzel, Valenzuela team up to take Dow lead
content: Sarah Schmelzel and Albane Valenzuela took a one-shot lead Saturday in the Dow Championship after shooting a 2-under 68 in alternate-shot play.

title: What's ahead in 2025 for Notre Dame, UConn and the Pac-2?
content: Could the Irish make another CFP run? Could UConn build on a breakthrough season? We break down what 2025 looks like.

title: Ravens' Kyle Hamilton reveals engagement to longtime girlfriend on Instagram
content: The Baltimore Ravens safety and Reese Damm, his now-fiancée, have been dating since high school and announced their engagement via a shared Instagram post.

title: PLL Power Rankings: Cannons the new No. 1
content: Margins are tight this season, but one club has risen to the top. Where do the rest land in the rankings?

title: A weird, wonderful night with Ryans, the Rockies and an unlikely world-record attempt
content: What happens when hundreds of Ryans -- no Bryans allowed! -- descend on Coors Field in the hopes of making history? Delightful chaos.﻿

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal enter race to sign Ekitike
content: Arsenal have Eintracht Frankfurt striker Hugo Ekitike in their sights. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Liverpool turn to Hato
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Complete draft order of picks for every round
content: When does your favorite team pick in every round of the draft? Here's a pick-by-pick look at all 20 rounds.

title: Women's Euros A-Z: The history of the tournament in 26 facts
content: England won the Women's Euros in 2022 and will attempt to retain it this summer, but before the fun gets started, let's run through the tournament's memorable moments.

title: State check: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 1 quiz
content: How well do you know your state sports trivia? From D.C. to Alabama, we're putting your knowledge to the test.

title: Week After Landslides, Train Ops Resume Between Northeast, Rest Of India
content: After six days of disruption due to landslides, train services between south Assam, Tripura, Manipur and Mizoram, and the rest of the country via Guwahati partially resumed on Sunday.

title: AAP Suspends Amritsar North MLA Kunwar Vijay Singh From Party For 5 Years
content: The AAP on Sunday suspended Amritsar North MLA and former IPS officer Kunwar Vijay Pratap Singh from the party for five years for allegedly indulging in anti-party activities.

title: Trinamool MLA Gets Notice For "Insensitive" Comments Over Kolkata Gang Rape
content: The Trinamool Congress on Sunday show caused party MLA Madan Mitra stating that his comments over the alleged gangrape of a law student in her college were uncalled for and insensitive.

title: Maharashtra Cancels Language Policy Resolution Amid Hindi Imposition Charge
content: The Maharashtra government has cancelled a resolution on the three language policy for schools, with Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis announcing a panel to discuss the way ahead.

title: How Democrats In America's Most Jewish City Embraced Israel Critic For New York Mayor
content: In choosing Zohran Mamdani as their candidate for mayor, Democrats in America's most Jewish city have nominated an outspoken critic of Israel, alarming some in New York's Jewish community.

title: Pools And Slides As North Korea Set To Open 'World Class' Tourist Resort
content: North Korea has completed construction on a massive tourist resort boasting colourful water slides and swimming pools, a pet project of leader Kim Jong Un.

title: "Surrender And Join The Mainstream": Amit Shah Rules Out Talks With Maoists
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday ruled out any talks with Maoists and said the cadre of the proscribed outfit should give up arms, surrender before police, and join the mainstream.

title: Indian Negotiators Extend US Stay As Trade Talks Gather Pace: Report
content: India's trade team has extended its stay in Washington to iron out differences as the two sides look to clinch a deal before a July 9 deadline when higher US tariffs are set to kick in, people familiar with the matter said.

title: 'Clean Air Zone' Trial To Be Launched In Delhi's Nehru Park
content: In a step towards exploring science-driven solutions for cleaning Delhi's air, Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa and PWD Minister and area MLA Parvesh Verma visited Nehru Park to review the feasibility of creating a pilot Clean Air Zone.

title: "Ready To Respond": Iran's New Warning To Israel Over Ceasefire Breach
content: Iran has cast doubts on the durability of the US-brokered ceasefire with Israel, warning it is ready to respond if hostilities with the Jewish state resume.

title: 2 Die After Cloudburst In Uttarakhand As Monsoon Covers Entire Country
content: A cloudburst in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district early Sunday left two construction workers dead and seven missing as monsoon covered the entire country almost a week earlier than usual.

title: "Quoted Out Of Context": India On Defence Attache's Op Sindoor Remark
content: The Indian embassy in Indonesia has said media reports have "quoted out of context" a presentation made by the defence attache at a seminar on Operation Sindoor.

title: Railways To Now Prepare Reservation Charts 8 Hours Before Train Departure
content: In a major move to enhance passenger convenience, Indian Railways on Sunday announced that it has decided to prepare the reservation chart 8 hours before the train's departure, instead of the current practice of 4 hours.

title: "Warm Temperature" In Cabin, Air India Tokyo-Delhi Flight Diverted To Kolkata
content: An Air India flight on Sunday was diverted to Kolkata due to "persistent warm temperature experienced in the cabin", said the airline.

title: China Rolls Over $3.4 Billion Of Commercial Loans To Pakistan: Report
content: China has rolled over $3.4 billion in loans to Islamabad, which together with other recent commercial and multilateral lending will boost Pakistan's foreign exchange reserves to $14 billion, a finance ministry source said.

title: Poll Body To Put Out 2003 Bihar Voters' List, 4.96 Crore Electors Need Not Give Documents
content: The Election Commission will soon upload the 2003 Bihar electoral roll on its website to facilitate the nearly 4.96 crore voters.

title: AI Is Learning To Lie, Scheme And Threaten Its Creators
content: The world's most advanced AI models are exhibiting troubling new behaviors - lying, scheming, and even threatening their creators to achieve their goals.

title: Analysis: US Strikes On Iran's Nuke Sites Set Up "Cat-And-Mouse" Hunt For Missing Uranium
content: The US and Israeli bombing of Iranian nuclear sites creates a conundrum for U.N. inspectors in Iran: how can you tell if enriched uranium stocks, some of them near weapons grade, were buried beneath the rubble or had been secretly hidden away?

title: Fighter Jets To Soon Be Able To Land On Assam Highways During Emergency: Himanta Sarma
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday said that the government has planned to make provisions for emergency landing of Indian Air Force fighter jets as well as civilian aircraft.

title: Fighter Jets To Soon Land On Assam Highways During Emergency: Himanta Sarma
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday said that the government has planned to make provisions for emergency landing of Indian Air Force fighter jets as well as civilian aircraft.
